text: is a former Japanese football player. He played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Yoshikawa was born in Mie Prefecture on December 13, 1961. After graduating from Yokkaichi Chuo Technical High School, he joined Hitachi in 1980. In 1992, he moved to Kyoto Shiko Club (later Kyoto Purple Sanga). In 1995, he moved to Kyoiku Kenkyusya (later FC Kyoken). He retired in 2000. On February 12, 1983, Yoshikawa debuted for the Japan national team against Syria. ==Statistics== Japan National Football Team Database |- |1983||1||0 |- !Total||1||0 |} ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1961 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Mie Prefecture Category:Japan international footballers Category:Japan Soccer League players Category:Kashiwa Reysol players Category:Kyoto Sanga FC players
title: Toru Yoshikawa
